docs.title: charmer
docs.text: A terminal user interface (TUI) for monitoring Snakemake pipelines running on HPC clusters.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Real-time monitoring - Watch pipeline jobs as they run on SLURM or LSF clusters
  • Unified view - Combines scheduler data with Snakemake metadata for complete visibility
  • Interactive TUI - Vim-style navigation, filtering, sorting, and log viewing
  • Multi-scheduler - Supports both SLURM and LSF cluster schedulers

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# Install
cargo install --git https://github.com/rnabioco/charmer-rs.git

# Run in your pipeline directory
cd /path/to/snakemake/pipeline
charmer

Press ? for help within the interface.

docs.title: Command Line Options
docs.text:
charmer [OPTIONS] [DIR]
Option Default Description DIR . Pipeline directory to monitor --poll-interval <SECS> 5 Seconds between scheduler queries --run-uuid <UUID> - Filter to specific Snakemake run --theme <THEME> dark Color theme (dark or light) --history-hours <N> 24 Show completed jobs from last N hours

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Monitor current directory
charmer

# Monitor specific directory
charmer /path/to/pipeline

# Poll every 10 seconds
charmer --poll-interval 10

# Filter to specific run
charmer --run-uuid abc123-def456

# Use light theme
charmer --theme light

# Show 48 hours of history
charmer --history-hours 48

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Description USER Used for filtering scheduler queries to your jobs RUST_LOG Set to debug for verbose logging

docs.title: File Locations
docs.text:
Charmer reads data from:

Path Description .snakemake/metadata/ Snakemake job metadata .snakemake/slurm_logs/ SLURM job logs .snakemake/lsf_logs/ LSF job logs

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Rust 1.85+ (for building from source)
  • Access to SLURM or LSF cluster commands

docs.title: From Source
docs.text:
cargo install --git https://github.com/rnabioco/charmer-rs.git

Or clone and build:

git clone https://github.com/rnabioco/charmer-rs.git
cd charmer-rs
cargo build --release
./target/release/charmer --help

docs.title: Pre-built Binaries
docs.text:
Download from the releases page:

  • charmer-linux-x86_64.tar.gz - Linux (glibc)
  • charmer-linux-x86_64-musl.tar.gz - Linux (musl, static)
  • charmer-macos-x86_64.tar.gz - macOS Intel
  • charmer-macos-aarch64.tar.gz - macOS Apple Silicon
curl -LO https://github.com/rnabioco/charmer-rs/releases/latest/download/charmer-linux-x86_64.tar.gz
tar xzf charmer-linux-x86_64.tar.gz
./charmer --help

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
Navigate to your Snakemake pipeline directory and run:

cd /path/to/my/pipeline
charmer

The TUI will display jobs from .snakemake/metadata/ and scheduler queries.

docs.title: Running Alongside Snakemake
docs.text:
Start your pipeline in one terminal:

snakemake --profile slurm -j 100

In another terminal, start charmer:

charmer

Charmer automatically detects new jobs as Snakemake submits them.

docs.title: Status Symbols
docs.text: Symbol Status ○ Pending ◐ Queued ● Running ✓ Completed ✗ Failed ⊘ Cancelled

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text: Key Action j / ↓ Move down k / ↑ Move up g / Home Go to first job G / End Go to last job

docs.title: Filtering & Sorting
docs.text: Key Action f Cycle filter (All → Running → Failed → Pending → Completed) s Cycle sort (Status → Rule → Time)

docs.title: Log Viewer
docs.text: Key Action l / Enter Open log viewer F Toggle follow mode q / Escape Close log viewer

docs.title: General
docs.text: Key Action ? Toggle help r Force refresh q / Ctrl+C Quit
